CatDescriptText: Raymond Pendleton, truck driver, Uptown and James Johnson Jr., spot laborer, Uptown, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 10, 1962, pg. 11 with question: "Do you think a shorter work week is the answer to the job loss posed by automation?" Mr. Pendleton's answer reads: "...In a way, it's something to work on.  But it's not going to solve the big problem because every time they cut off three men, they only return one to work."  Mr. Johnson's answer reads: "Yes, for one reason because lots of jobs, even jobs as spot laborers, are scarce.  This has to be the answer because it spreads the jobs."
TitMainTitle: Raymond Pendleton wearing dark corduroy jacket, and James Johnson Jr., standing in front of wall inscribed Barney's
